title: Luis Rubiales says he is resigning as head of Spain's soccer federation
description: Luis Rubiales says he is resigning as president of Spain's soccer federation after he kissed a star player on the mouth after the Women's World Cup final.

title: Hurricane Lee is forecast to push dangerous surf along the U.S. East Coast
description: The powerful Category 3 storm is expected to bring dangerous surf to the U.S. East Coast starting on Sunday. Forecasters said Lee is likely to restrengthen as it moves northwest in the coming days.

title: Moroccan rescue teams face challenges in reaching earthquake victims in the mountains
description: Remote villages in the Atlas Mountains are among the hardest hit by Friday's earthquake that killed more than 2,000. Crews are struggling to reach communities amid aftershocks and damaged roads.

title: Pennsylvania police say an escaped killer has stolen a van and shaved his facial hair
description: Police say Danelo Cavalcante, 34, was spotted on a doorbell camera in Phoenixville, about a 40-minute drive from where he had previously been seen.

title: He's a singer, a cop and the inspiration for a Netflix film about albinism in Africa
description: "Can You See Us?" is the story of a boy growing up with albinism in Zambia. His father spurns him, his peers attack him. It's based on the life of John Chiti, who spoke to NPR about his experiences.

title: Electric cars have a road trip problem, even for the secretary of energy
description: A road trip I took with Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm confirmed one thing: The U.S. is wrestling with an inadequate charging network (unless you're a Tesla driver).

title: The U.S. set the stage for a coup in Chile. It had unintended consequences at home
description: When the U.S. role in the 1973 coup in Chile became known, activists took action. So did U.S. lawmakers. This is what happened after the U.S. helped topple a Marxist and aided a right-wing dictator.

title: What to know about Florida's 'classic' alternative to the SAT
description: Florida's state universities will start accepting an alternative to the SAT exam that's known for its Christian and conservative backing.

title: For a new generation of Marines, 9/11 is history
description: For many Americans, 9/11 is now simply a date to mark, much like December 7th and the Pearl Harbor attacks. Even the military war colleges are moving on.

title: Phoenix has set another heat record by hitting 110 degrees on 54 days this year
description: On Saturday, it was the 54th day this year that the official reading at Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport hit 110 degrees, eclipsing the previous record set in 2020. The hot streak could reach 55 days.

title: Coco Gauff wins the U.S. Open for her first Grand Slam title at age 19
description: Gauff surged to her first major championship by coming back to defeat Aryna Sabalenka 2-6, 6-3, 6-2 in the U.S. Open final on Saturday, delighting a raucous crowd that was loud from start to finish.
